prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
Example:
Question:
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My first client. Just standing in front of this guy makes me nervous...
Character 1
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: The victim in this case. A traveler, only recently back in-country.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. For all his experience, he lacks a certain presence...
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.
Evidence 1
Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.
Evidence 2:
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.
Evidence 3:
Name: Medical Report Card
Description: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.
Evidence 4:
Name: Photograph of Handbag
Description: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.
Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.
Person: Nosa
Testimony 1
Testimony 1: Myself, I was extolling the virtues of a particularly fine golden curio to the military gentleman.
Person: Korekuta
Testimony 2
Testimony 2: At that precise moment, a firearm was discharged! I observed the enemy's actions with my own eyes!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 3
Testimony 3: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 4
Testimony 4: I was on my hands and knees, investigating the where-abouts of my mysteriously absconded precious curio.
Person: Korekuta

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.
Testimony 3 states that the gun shot was fired "from the back". However, Evidence 0, which is "Post-Mortem Report," states that the victim died "from a gunshot to the chest", which implies that the witness is lying.
{"evidence": 0, "testimony": 3}
Question:Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the statements.

Testimony 0 states that Ihmus was "at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum" and Testimony 3 claims that from there, he "used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum." Testimony 4 states, "That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!"

Now, looking at the evidence, specifically Evidence 11, "Mountain Range Poster," it says: "A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east." The Inner Sanctum is a different peak, higher than Mt. Poniponi, and the Inner Sanctum is surrounded by a "Ritual Curtain" (Evidence 4), which is described as a curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.

If the Inner Sanctum is surrounded by a curtain, the view inside would have been obstructed. Thus, it directly contradicts Ihmus's testimony that he saw the stabbing take place with binoculars from a mountain next door.

Therefore, Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain) and Testimony 4 (Ihmus claims to see the stabbing from Mt. Poniponi) contradict each other.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's examine the relevant evidence and testimonies.

Testimony 1 states: "The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night." This means the witness claims the silhouettes on the ritual curtain were created by moonlight.

However, according to Evidence 2 (May 9th Newspaper), "The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight." The important point here is that the Purification Rite begins when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi (see Evidence 1: Rites Guide), so the moon should be over the sky at the time of the rite. But if you examine Evidence 7 (Inner Sanctum Photo) and Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain: entrance shut during the rite), you realize that the only light sources are lanterns inside, as the curtain "isolates it from the outside world" (Evidence 4). This means moonlight should not be able to project silhouettes on the curtain from inside the sanctum, contradicting the assertion that the shadows were made by moonlight outside.

But let's focus on the strongest contradiction. Evidence 4 specifically says: "A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite." If the curtain is fully enclosing the sanctum, no external light—such as moonlight—can project onto it. So, Testimony 1 is contradicted by Evidence 4.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was never at the Inner Sanctum, I tell ya!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: That much I'm sure of, even with the fuzzy memory.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: Besides, it woulda been impossible to get there in the first place!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: The plaza gate is locked from the side facing the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 5
Testimony: It's not like I can fly through the air, either!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 6
Testimony: Boy, you lawyers sure are scary!
Person: Ihmus

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies.

Testimony 3 claims: "No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!" This testimony suggests that access to the Inner Sanctum was impossible via the cliffs. However, Evidence 2 ("May 9th Newspaper") states: "The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned."

If the ice that originally covered the area between the Inner Sanctum and the Plaza has melted, that means travel was possible at the time in question. This contradicts the testimony that nobody could have climbed up due to impassable cliffs. Thus, the claim of impossibility is undercut by the evidence of newly possible access once the ice melted.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
Example:
Question:
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My first client. Just standing in front of this guy makes me nervous...
Character 1
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: The victim in this case. A traveler, only recently back in-country.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. For all his experience, he lacks a certain presence...
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.
Evidence 1
Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.
Evidence 2:
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.
Evidence 3:
Name: Medical Report Card
Description: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.
Evidence 4:
Name: Photograph of Handbag
Description: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.
Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.
Person: Nosa
Testimony 1
Testimony 1: Myself, I was extolling the virtues of a particularly fine golden curio to the military gentleman.
Person: Korekuta
Testimony 2
Testimony 2: At that precise moment, a firearm was discharged! I observed the enemy's actions with my own eyes!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 3
Testimony 3: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 4
Testimony 4: I was on my hands and knees, investigating the where-abouts of my mysteriously absconded precious curio.
Person: Korekuta

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.
Testimony 3 states that the gun shot was fired "from the back". However, Evidence 0, which is "Post-Mortem Report," states that the victim died "from a gunshot to the chest", which implies that the witness is lying.
{"evidence": 0, "testimony": 3}

Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That evening, I was enjoying a trek through the night sky with my homemade paraglider.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: But just as Mt. Poniponi was drawing near, something terrible happened!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: An accident forced me to make an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: Gale force winds came out of nowhere, so I made an emergency landing at the sanctum!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: As I landed, I banged my head, causing me to lose my memory!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 5
Testimony: So you see, I ended up at the Inner Sanctum purely by accident!
Person: Ihmus

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
First, let's look for a contradiction between the evidence and the testimonies, focusing on the details of the weather and location.

Testimony 3 from Ihmus: "Gale force winds came out of nowhere, so I made an emergency landing at the sanctum!"

Now, let's look for evidence that could contradict the claim of "gale force winds" at the Inner Sanctum during the relevant time period.

Evidence 2: May 9th Newspaper
Description: The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.

The evidence, specifically the weather report for the relevant day, states that there were calm, clear skies (i.e., no dangerous winds) during the day around the Inner Sanctum, which directly contradicts Ihmus's statement about encountering "gale force winds" that forced an emergency landing at the sanctum.
